title: Testing Strategy Quiz
description: Test your understanding of testing strategies for KMP applications.

questions.text: In the testing pyramid, which layer should have the MOST tests in a KMP project?
questions.explanation: Unit tests form the base of the testing pyramid. In KMP, shared business logic in commonMain should have the most tests because they run on all platforms without platform-specific setup.

questions.text: What is the primary advantage of testing shared KMP code in commonTest?
options: Tests run faster than platform-specific tests
Tests automatically verify behavior on ALL target platforms
Tests don't need any test framework
questions.explanation: Tests in commonTest run on every configured target (JVM, iOS, JS, etc.), ensuring shared logic works identically across platforms. This is the core value proposition of KMP testing.

questions.text: When should you use platform-specific test source sets (e.g., androidUnitTest, iosTest)?
options: For all tests to ensure platform correctness
Only when testing expect/actual implementations or platform-specific behavior
questions.explanation: Platform-specific test source sets are needed when testing expect/actual declarations, platform-specific drivers (SQLDelight drivers, Ktor engines), or behavior that differs by platform.
